product_name: OnePlus Nord CE4 (Celadon Marble, 8GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | Lifetime Display Warranty | Qualcomm¬Æ...
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 OnePlus Nord CE4 the EXTRAORDINARY!!!
content:
I usually not write ‚úçÔ∏è review very fast when it comes to smartphone. First I need to use it and under rigorous testing only I can put forward my verdict so that any brother or sister can buy the same from Amazon.
BODY : OnePlus has comeup with a very durable body and stylish. Looking premium.

DISPLAY: Its a PureAmoled with 10Bit resolution with crispy HDR10 features. Vibrant natural color and screen ratio is 88.5% to body ratio. So very less bezels.

BATTERY: Easily comes for 1 and half day if not playing any games. With games 1 day. No idle midnight auto battery drain and all. 5500mAh is very slowly discharging and due to 100w charger coming inside the box the mobile charges in 17 to 18minutes only upto 85% and full 100% charging approx 19 minutes as per my test.

CAMERA: Very ok for the price. I got one update recently in May 25, 2024 and after this the camera works wonderful specially selfie and portrait mode.

PROCESSOR: Snapdragon 7Gen3 name is enough that it is very stable and fast multi tasking and even this snapdragon version not heats up fastly. The clock speed is amazingly impressive to any games like PUBG or FreeFires or Asphalt. Rest all the medium games runs smoothly. No throttle. No lag and even No uncommon heating issues etc.

METWORK: Very fast 5G and even 4G also no issues. Runs smoothly without any call drop or any disturbance in voice quality. The Voice Focus mode works very nice even in the rush or crowded metro area. Last time recorded download speed was 175mbps & upload speed approx 145 to 166mbps.

STEREO SPEAKERS: This is what attracted me the most. The stereo speakers are very loud enough. And even it sync the eaarpods very quickly. OnePlus earpods are recommended for all those EQ and bass.

OVERALL VERDICT: Very lightest mobile inspite of 5500 mAh battery. Too premium boxy design. Call and network speed very impressive. After investing on this phone I have not regretted. Highly recommended and Value for money. Thanks Seller and Amazon. 100w charger in the box. Backcase and screen guard all in the box. A complete midrange killer phone. Highly valuable.

product_name: OnePlus Nord CE4 (Celadon Marble, 8GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | Lifetime Display Warranty | Qualcomm¬Æ...
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 OnePlus Nord CE 4 ‚Äì Great Overall, Just a Bit Power Hungry on Mobile Data
content:
I've been using the OnePlus Nord CE 4 for a few weeks now, and honestly, it‚Äôs a solid phone for the price. The performance is smooth ‚Äî apps open quickly, switching between them is fast, and there‚Äôs no lag even when I‚Äôm playing games or watching videos. The display is bright, super responsive with the 120Hz refresh rate, and looks great for watching content or just scrolling.

The design feels premium even though it‚Äôs lightweight, and the camera has been surprisingly good, especially in daylight. Pictures come out sharp and colors are natural ‚Äî not overly saturated.

Battery life is mostly pretty good. On Wi-Fi or casual use, it easily lasts a full day. But I did notice that it consumes a bit more battery when I‚Äôm using mobile data or doing WhatsApp video calls. It‚Äôs not terrible, but it‚Äôs noticeable, especially if you‚Äôre on video calls for a long time or out and about without Wi-Fi.

The good news is the charging is ridiculously fast. I can go from nearly 0 to 100% in around half an hour with the 100W SUPERVOOC charger, so even if the battery drains a bit faster sometimes, it‚Äôs super easy to top it up quickly.

All in all, the Nord CE 4 is a great pick if you're looking for a powerful mid-range phone with a clean user experience. Just keep in mind that video calls on mobile data can drain the battery a bit faster ‚Äî but the fast charging totally makes up for it.

product_name: OnePlus Nord CE4 (Celadon Marble, 8GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | Lifetime Display Warranty | Qualcomm¬Æ...
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
 Thik Thak Phone
content:
The display is good ‚Äî smooth, with minimal bezels ‚Äî and the fingerprint sensor is fast and responsive.
Performance is solid for day-to-day tasks. I don‚Äôt play heavy games, so I can‚Äôt comment on gaming performance.
The battery easily lasts a full day, but you‚Äôll need to charge it the next day. The charger is unnecessarily fast, as the phone gets slightly warm while charging.
The camera is good but not great. It does the job, but don‚Äôt expect too much.
The software feels exactly like Realme and Oppo phones ‚Äî it just carries the OxygenOS name. There‚Äôs a lot of bloatware, and you have to accept many unnecessary privacy policies and terms and conditions just to enable basic features like Global Search or the camera. If you want good software then, go for Nothing, Samsung, or Pixel phones instead.
Still, it‚Äôs a decent Chinese phone at 19K.

title:

 Z 10R experience
content: Excellent to use. Best camera ever used and great at gaming experience. The ui quality is awesome as well.

product_name: iQOO Z10R 5G (Aquamarine, 8GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | 32MP 4K Selfie Camera | Quad-Curved AMOLED Di...
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 great daily driver, with one flaw
content:
i have a lot of phones, as amazon and flipkart already know. but, i do NOT use my mid/high end phones as my daily drivers. my gaming phones are stuck at home and have almost never seen the world outside my house. i will also tell you why i don't use my mid/high end phones outside - because i tend to drop them, crack them, etc.

but sometime in august/september i realized that i was doing so many things on my daily use phone that i needed a decent mid range phone. and that is when the search began. i had zeroed in on 4 different mid range phones, but i decided to settle on this one.

my main criteria for choosing a new phone was that it had to be decently powerful (able to create a presentation, in the worst of the cases), and MORE IMPORTANTLY, this new phone had to be very light weight.

this phone, the iqoo z10r fit the bill in every way, but one (wait for it).

the other phone i almost bought, but didn't really, was the tecno pova curve. that's a slim, light weight phone with a decent chipset (7300). it lost in the looks department.

but this phone had a lot of things going for it: a solid chipset (7400), great cameras (for a mid range phone, especially with the vivo legacy), fairly slim, and fairly light weight.

i have been using this phone as my daily driver for the past few months now, and the iqoo z10r has NOT disappointed in most departments, spare one: this phone is wide! had this phone been a little more wide... this phone would have been a square! holding the phone in a single hand is NOT easy because of how wide the phone is.

i am not a fan of the camera bump either. and the light... again, i am not a fan of it.

the front camera quality is amazing. rear cameras... i am not so sure. they are okay. my low/mid range infinix, redmi and realme phones probably take equally good, if not better pictures with their rear cameras, when compared to this phone's rear cameras.

another big problem: i think this phone could get damaged quite easily given how thin it is. just an hour back i was getting out of my friend's car, and my phone was in between my legs, or maybe i was sitting on it, and the phone fell on a concrete road, as i exited the vehicle. for a minute i thought: there goes my 20k. luckily i had bought a decently tough cover for the phone, so the phone survived (i hope). let's see... we will know if this phone can actually survive a few feet falls onto heavy concrete streets.

i have played multiple games on this phone - bgmi, racing games, some low end games, etc, and they all run smoothly. my ancient redmi k50 supports smooth + extreme+, but this phone supports only smooth + extreme. doesn't make much of a difference for me as i am a casual bgmi warrior.

overall, this is a good phone for the price, if you can overlook the fact that it is VERY WIDE!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 Here‚Äôs a detailed review of the Motorola G45 5G, a strong contender in the budget smartphone segment
content:
‚úÖ Should You Buy It?

Great Choice If You Want

A smooth 120‚ÄØHz smartphone experience

Clean Android with solid performance

Long-lasting battery with decent charging

Look Elsewhere If You Prefer

AMOLED display (for sharper, punchier visuals)

Top-tier camera performance or faster charging

Higher-resolution screen at similar price

üëç Pros

120‚ÄØHz Smooth Display: One of the highest refresh rates in its range, making navigation & scrolling feel fluid

Reliable Performance: Snapdragon‚ÄØ6s Gen‚ÄØ3 handles daily tasks like browsing, social apps, and light gaming well ‚Äî noted as ‚Äúvery good‚Äù in benchmarks

Clean Stock Android Feel: Minimal bloatware with Motorola‚Äôs helpful gestures and features

üëé Cons

Display Limitations: 720p resolution feels less sharp; brightness and color gamut lag behind AMOLED rivals

Camera Software Issues: Camera app can be sluggish, macro shots are underwhelming

Notification Spam: Some users noted annoying pre-installed notification prompts

Charging Speed: 20‚ÄØW is slower than the 33‚Äì53‚ÄØW charging seen in some competitors

üó£Ô∏è Real-World Feedback

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a solid budget phone with a great design, good performance, nice cameras, and a smooth user experience‚Äù

‚ÄúFor call, WhatsApp, YouTube etc it‚Äôs performing decently well‚Äù

product_name: Motorola G45 5G (Brilliant Blue, 8GB RAM, 128GB Storage)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Sim card and memory card slot issue
content: The 2nd sim and memory card slot is merged so you can either have 2 sims or 1 sim and 1 memory card..this is kind of a technical backwardness and very disappointing. There is no photo gallery app, i had to download one. While camera is good, photo editing is a hassle. Otherwise its a decent phone. Its value for money, performance is good. Doesnt heat up. Charges fast. But i had to let go of my memory card to accommodate both sim cards.

product_name: Redmi 13 5G Prime Edition, Hawaiian Blue, 8GB+128GB | India Debut SD 4 Gen 2 AE | 108MP Pro Grade...
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
 Works faster than other mobiles at this price.
content: It is very long vertically, to the extent that it feels weird. Not good if you are looking for something handy and pocket friendly. Other than that, it's 8GB RAM and 128GB storage is pretty nice for the given price point. I got it for 11k. Also a major difference maker it the processing chip, the Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 AE performs miles better than all those cheap Dimensity Mediatek chips. So it would not start lagging within a year and will actually perform in intense situations, good for multi-tasking. The display is good for it's large screen and looks are also neat with that glassy back. The only problem is the MI OS that includes unwanted apps and games and some ads as well, if you can manage those then go for this product.

product_name: Redmi 13 5G Prime Edition, Hawaiian Blue, 8GB+128GB | India Debut SD 4 Gen 2 AE | 108MP Pro Grade...
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
 ONLY FOR REDMI LOVERS
content: As always The Redmi 13 5G stands out in the budget segment by offering a surprisingly premium "Crystal Glass Design" and class-leading optics, centered around a powerful 108MP main camera that captures excellent daylight photos. Beyond its looks, the phone provides a very smooth daily experience thanks to the large 6.79-inch FHD+ display with a fluid 120Hz refresh rate and dependable performance from the Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 AE chipset running Xiaomi's new HyperOS. Crucially, it boasts an impressive 5030mAh battery with 33W fast charging, making it a robust, stylish, and long-lasting choice for buyers who prioritize aesthetics and photography on a limited budget.

product_name: Redmi 13 5G Prime Edition, Hawaiian Blue, 8GB+128GB | India Debut SD 4 Gen 2 AE | 108MP Pro Grade...
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
 Good mobile and value for money (8+128)
content:
As per price this mobile is a good option if the budget is under 12k .
While company provide some good specs like fhd display, good processor, 108 mp camera, 33w charger they also cut cost to battery quality, speaker even in display and camera .
It's a fhd display but not support true fhd colours and smoothness.
This processor can't handle multitasking for heavy apps especially for modern days heavy games.
It's provide a 4nm tech processor but the battery draining is more than expected even in normal use so the power efficiency branding is a eyewash . You get a option for turbo charging to get rid of this .
Speaker quality is not good . Sound is not clear and loud .
But still it's a good option under 12k . Don't expect high quality in low budget phones .
